modes.notes: Subway system operates 24/7, covers Manhattan and all boroughs. Flat fare of $2.75 per ride. Most reliable and cost-effective option for business travelers. Plan for approximately 1 hour of potential delays.
Extensive network covering areas not served by subway. Slower than subway due to traffic but offers city views. Uses same MetroCard payment as subway.
Scenic waterfront routes offering views of city skyline and landmarks. Practical for specific waterfront destinations.
Commuter rail connecting to suburban areas and airport connections via AirTrain.
Regional rail service connecting to areas north of NYC.
National passenger railroad service connecting major US cities to Penn Station in Midtown Manhattan.

payment_methods.details: Tap contactless card or phone at turnstile for subway and bus access. Modern payment option accepted on all MTA services.
Reloadable card purchased at station kiosks or shops. Flat rate of $2.75 per ride for subway and bus.
Paper ticket for one journey on subway or bus.

operating_hours.weekday: Subway operates 24/7. Most lines run frequently 5am-midnight, with reduced service midnight-5am. Buses operate 5am-1am with limited night routes.
operating_hours.weekend: Subway operates 24/7 with modified schedules. Buses operate 5am-1am with limited night routes.
operating_hours.night_service: 24/7 subway service available. Select bus routes operate overnight. Plan extra time for late-night travel.

rideshare.notes: Widely available throughout NYC. Approximately $60 from JFK to Manhattan. Convenient for luggage-heavy airport transfers but expect gridlock during peak hours (8-10am, 4-7pm).
App-based rideshare service available across five boroughs. Door-to-door convenience but expensive for frequent use.
Traditional cabs available for street hailing or designated taxi stands. Convenient but subject to Midtown and Downtown gridlock.

tips: For business travelers: (1) Plan commute with 1-hour buffer for potential subway delays; arrive 10-15 minutes early to meetings. (2) Subway is fastest and most reliable during peak hours (8-10am, 4-7pm) when traffic gridlocks taxis and rideshares. (3) Use OMNY contactless payment or MetroCard for seamless transit. (4) For airport arrival with luggage, consider AirTrain + subway ($10.25 total) over Uber ($60) to save costs. (5) Key business districts: Midtown (offices, conference centers, Grand Central/Penn Station), Financial District (Wall Street, WTC), Chelsea (creative vibe, Penn Station access). (6) Walking is often faster for short distances. (7) Avoid relying on taxis/rideshares due to cost and traffic; use subway for efficiency. (8) Download CityMapper app for real-time transit planning and commute tracking.
